definition: betrayal/defection/turncoat/to change sides politically
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: I'll burn him, and show the north how I deal with turncloaks and traitors .
sentences.chinese: 我會燒了他，以示北境我是如何處理叛徒和變節者的。

sentences.english: Little imagine Zhang Wanchuan defection, already become a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知張萬川早已變節，成爲叛徒。

sentences.english: I'm a renegade, a turncoat, a Scalawag.
sentences.chinese: 我是個叛徒，變節者，流氓。

sentences.english: Do not proselytize your work or ideas.
sentences.chinese: 不要變節你的工作或觀念。

sentences.english: The most furious anarchist become the most barefaced apostate .
sentences.chinese: 最激烈的無政府主義者，居然成了最露骨的變節者。

sentences.english: The technological process for making narrow-leaf heLix with varying pitches was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹一種窄片狀變節距螺旋零件的扭制加工工藝。

sentences.english: Some people switch allegiances more often than they change their wardrobe.
sentences.chinese: 有些人時常變節，比他們變換衣櫃裏的衣裳還要頻密。

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to obstruct/to impede
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
to die in battle (idiom)
a spy/a crafty person
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
royalists
